name: 1 Day Summer Cheese School
description:
Make your own cheese on the farm at Corleggy, Co.Cavan with Silke Cropp. Spend the day learning the art of cheesemaking from Silke who has been making goat, cow and sheep cheeses for yonks. Take home your very own kilo of cow's milk cheese. Most of all take home the experience! Full day including lunch and vino. Don't forget your bucket! 
€150 for one person or €250 for two!
The next class is on 6th May 2012!

name: Drumlin
description: Drumlin is a raw cow's milk cheese handmade in Cavan by Silke Cropp. It is available in many varieties. Choose from Traditional, Beech-Smoked, Garlic, Peppercorn, Seaweed or Cumin in the drop down box.

name: Corleggy
description:
Corleggy is a hard cheese hand made from raw goats milk.
Every individual cheese has been matured to just the right degree, from 8 weeks to 4 months, depending on the season, weather, humidity and last but not least, the mixture of grass and herbs available to the goats at the time of making the cheese.
The rind of Corleggy is natural, formed by bathing the cheeses in sea salt brine. It is edible and very flavoursome. Some experts regard it as the best bit of the cheese.
Hard cheese made from goat’s milk is a rare find. This one is particularly special because the production process is very small. Corleggy is perfect as the centrepiece of a cheese board, but we also recommend you try it with fruit such as fresh figs or sweet plums.

name: Creeny
description: Creeny raw milk sheep’s milk cheese is one of the only raw milk cheeses produced in Ireland at the moment. Between 2 to 6 months old, the cheese is semi hard but with good flavours, which show real promise in maturity. At about a year, the cheese is hard and very like Pecorino, with a potent, piquant pepperiness.
